programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team pursues a serial killer with a grisly desire to look at his victims' faces as they die, and the trail leads into the world of academic philosophy. However, Nikki is distracted from the case by the death of her grandmother, while Harry investigates the demise of a woman who apparently drowned in three inches of water.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: When Justice Isn't Enough - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of three. An anonymous caller alerts Phil Hunter to common threads in recent murders, and the team starts looking for a serial killer on the Sun Hill gay scene. Lance Powell struggles to come to terms with Mark's decision to take time out from their relationship and decides to drown his sorrows, but a visit to the gay bar he recently investigated puts him in grave danger.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch is called to a factory where a man has been crushed, while Carole's future is uncertain. Elsewhere, a resident complains about the siren noise from the station.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Carol's attempts to give Sonia a birthday she will remember go awry, Sanjay makes an enemy of Ian, and Pat is forced to face some home truths about life after Frank.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five family members from Northumberland answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge. They then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: That's So Magic
programme.desc: Keep it here on Magic for all your favourite videos from the biggest artists ever.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Kisstory: Old Skool & Anthems
programme.desc: It's time to go back in time with KISSTORY! The biggest old skool anthems ever from your favourite artists.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how one of the fastest bikes in the world was created, how pilots train to perform death-defying acrobatics, and how oil and gas is brought up from the bottom of the sea.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a clean Subaru Impreza WRX at a good price, and hands it to Edd China to make it stand out by giving it a performance boost and changing its appearance.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While Frank Fritz is on the mend. Mike Wolfe and his brother Robbie crisscross Colorado and find a giant cow-shaped RV.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.sub-title: On the Road - European Tour: Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. The OCC crew heads to Europe for a family holiday, taking in the sights in London, and heading out on the open road in Ireland on bikes.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Documentary following the Tweto family's airline, which sees the pilots bringing supplies to villages in western Alaska following two months of darkness. Company COO Jim tries to land on a frozen river, while Luke Hickerson has problems taking off and vaccines are delivered to Russia.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe tries to withstand the harsh cold weather of the Soo Locks in winter and help out with their annual clean.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes behind the making of drill bits, photo booths and stamps, and the way their manufacture has changed with technological advances.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes behind yacht wheels, braided rugs, car thermostats and chisels.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Recounting how years after a successful TV producer was gunned down in his New York office, a tip led the FBI to a murderous entertainment industry giant.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How forensic examiners can expose a killer's deadly intentions when murder victims are lured to their deaths by acquaintances.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case in which a couple, recently engaged, were found brutally murdered in a car. Footage from a surveillance camera gave the police their first break.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The September 2011 murders of Roy Napier, his estranged wife Angela, their two adult children and neighbour Henry Smith. Gunman David Ison had earlier argued with Napier over his decision to add $2 to the price of prescription pills he was selling.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The 1993 investigation into the murder of a 74-year-old man in his home, revealing how evidence linked the crime to an escaped prisoner and his girlfriend.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators try to seize seven horses from a waterlogged field, but find the beasts much more reluctant to leave than they expected.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: When Boris the Staffy was born he had a cleft palate, and Chris attempts a type of complex surgery that has never been performed in the country before to help save his life.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Helena wants her eight bridesmaids to wear a different vintage dress as Lori tries to prevent the bride's vision from looking like chaos.
